article.title: Likely Transiting Exocomets Detected by Kepler

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the approximate depth of the deepest transit events observed in the Kepler lightcurve of KIC 3542116?
What is the likely cause of the periodicities observed near 1 day in the Fourier Transform of the KIC 3542116 lightcurve?
choices: Rotation of the star with starspots

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the characteristic shape of the deep transit events observed in KIC 3542116 after removing the stellar variability?
choices: Symmetrical, with equal ingress and egress times
Asymmetrical, with steeper ingress and slower egress
Box-shaped, with flat bottoms and sharp edges

multiple_choice_question.text: According to the statistical assessment presented in Figure 11, what is the most likely range of orbital periods for the objects causing the deeper transits in KIC 3542116?
This formula estimates the minimum mass of dust required to block 0.1% of the host star\'s light during a transit event. What does the parameter *œÅ<sub>d</sub>* represent in this equation?
choices: The radius of the host star
The orbital period of the transiting object
The bulk density of the dust
The distance to the host star
